elements.title: How Quantum Computers Will Correct Their Errors
elements.contents: Quantum bits are fussy and fragile. Useful quantum computers will need to use an error-correction technique like the one that was recently demonstrated on a real machine.

elements.title: Surprising Limits Discovered in Quest for Optimal Solutions
elements.contents: Algorithms that zero in on solutions to optimization problems are the beating heart of machine reasoning. New results reveal surprising limits.

elements.title: The Uselessness of Useful Knowledge
elements.contents: Today’s powerful but little-understood artificial intelligence breakthroughs echo past examples of unexpected scientific progress.

elements.title: Neuron Bursts Can Mimic Famous AI Learning Strategy
elements.contents: A new model of learning centers on bursts of neural activity that act as teaching signals — approximating backpropagation, the algorithm behind learning in AI.
